intro: Hexaptera cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hexaptera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Hexaptera cuneata is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
